results.definition: a course of reasoning aimed at demonstrating a truth or falsehood; the methodical process of logical reasoning
examples: I can't follow your line of reasoning

results.definition: a slight depression or fold in the smoothness of a surface
examples: his face has many lines

results.definition: mechanical system in a factory whereby an article is conveyed through sites at which successive operations are performed on it
a connected series of events or actions or developments
examples: historians can only point out those lines for which evidence is available

results.definition: the road consisting of railroad track and roadbed
a conceptual separation or distinction
examples: there is a narrow line between sanity and insanity

results.definition: a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
a conductor for transmitting electrical or optical signals or electric power
the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
examples: he's not in my line of business

results.definition: make a mark or lines on a surface
examples: draw a line
trace the outline of a figure in the sand

results.definition: (often plural) a means of communication or access
examples: lines of communication were set up between the two firms

results.definition: the descendants of one individual
examples: his entire lineage has been warriors

results.definition: space for one line of print (one column wide and 1/14 inch deep) used to measure advertising
a short personal letter
examples: drop me a line when you get there

results.definition: a telephone connection
be in line with; form a line along
examples: trees line the riverbank

results.definition: the maximum credit that a customer is allowed
a particular kind of product or merchandise
examples: a nice line of shoes

results.definition: a pipe used to transport liquids or gases
examples: a pipeline runs from the wells to the seaport

results.definition: a commercial organization serving as a common carrier
acting in conformity
examples: in line with
he got out of line
toe the line

results.definition: a formation of people or things one behind another
examples: the line stretched clear around the corner
you must wait in a long line at the checkout counter

results.definition: a formation of people or things one beside another
examples: the line of soldiers advanced with their bayonets fixed
they were arrayed in line of battle
the cast stood in line for the curtain call

results.definition: a fortified position (especially one marking the most forward position of troops)
examples: they attacked the enemy's line

results.definition: a length (straight or curved) without breadth or thickness; the trace of a moving point
a mark that is long relative to its width
examples: He drew a line on the chart

results.definition: a single frequency (or very narrow band) of radiation in a spectrum
a spatial location defined by a real or imaginary unidimensional extent
cover the interior of
examples: line the gloves
line a chimney

results.definition: fill plentifully
examples: line one's pockets

results.definition: in games or sports; a mark indicating positions or bounds of the playing area
mark with lines
examples: sorrow had lined his face

results.definition: persuasive but insincere talk that is usually intended to deceive or impress
examples: `let me show you my etchings' is a rather worn line
he has a smooth line but I didn't fall for it
that salesman must have practiced his fast line of talk

results.definition: reinforce with fabric
examples: lined books are more enduring

results.definition: something (as a cord or rope) that is long and thin and flexible
examples: a washing line

results.definition: text consisting of a row of words written across a page or computer screen
examples: the letter consisted of three short lines
there are six lines in every stanza
